SD_LastNightAlive.synopsis: Gale re-examines his position re: exploding.

SD_AfterElminsterVisit.synopsis: Gale Avatar has gotten Elminster's message that he should kill the Absolute... and himself in the process.

SD_KnowCrownKarsus.synopsis: Having confirmation that the Crown is indeed the Crown of Karsus, Gale is poised to take a shot at Mystra's throne.

SD_LastNightAlive_12.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_12.text: *Another restless night beckons. Your mind flits from memory to memory, the deeds you've done and left undone in the wake of Mystra's instruction.*

SD_LastNightAlive_50.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_50.text: *Her presence haunts your every decision - the ones she would endorse, and those she would disdain. Defy her doctrines while she watches, and you would not be merely disobedient. You would be dangerous.*

SD_LastNightAlive_16.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_16.text: *Though the night is still, your heart feels quite the opposite. Elminster's letter has given you much to digest.*
SD_LastNightAlive_16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale lies on his bed roll, restless

SD_LastNightAlive_59.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_59.text: *Can it really be true? Does he believe Mystra's instruction is wrong?*

SD_LastNightAlive_34.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_34.text: He defies Mystra himself in saying so. He wouldn't do that without good reason.

SD_LastNightAlive_25.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_25.text: *In all the years you've known Elminster, he's never once questioned his goddess' wisdom. For him to do so now... there must be something to this.*

SD_LastNightAlive_13.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_13.text: Elminster's an enigma. Who knows what games he's playing.

SD_LastNightAlive_0.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_0.text: *None can truly know what goes on beneath Elminster's tattered old hat. Just because he has centuries worth of wisdom, doesn't mean he's direct, or honest, in sharing it.*

SD_LastNightAlive_46.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_46.text: *You finally appear to be winning back Mystra's favour, even her blessings. But appearances are not everything, and after all - she does not give without expecting in return.*

SD_LastNightAlive_19.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_19.text: She gives what she can. And you receive her aid gratefully.

SD_LastNightAlive_35.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_35.text: *It brings you comfort, knowing that Mystra's hand rests on your shoulder. Though she remains aloof, she does not send you to your fate alone.*

SD_LastNightAlive_33.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_33.text: *Are you truly ready to sacrifice yourself for her?*

SD_LastNightAlive_40.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_40.text: No. If Elminster believes there's another way, so do you.

SD_LastNightAlive_45.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_45.text: *Mystra's conclusion is based on a flawed assumption. The orb cannot be the only means of destroying the Absolute, though she may think it the most convenient.*

SD_LastNightAlive_27.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_27.text: *What that alternative may be, you have yet to discover. But you will discover it. Whether Mystra wants you to or not.*

SD_LastNightAlive_60.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_60.text: You'll die on nobody's orders. Especially not hers.

SD_LastNightAlive_57.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_57.text: *Mystra has forgotten how carefully mortals tend to their brief and fragile lives. And what lengths they will go to to protect them.*

SD_LastNightAlive_32.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_32.text: *You may yet have cause to remind her.*

SD_LastNightAlive_30.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_30.text: Not for her, but for everyone else.

SD_LastNightAlive_3.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_3.text: *Mystra's fate is none of your concern. But you will not allow mortal innocents to die by the Absolute's hand. Not when it lies in your power to prevent it.*

SD_LastNightAlive_6.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_6.text: *If the orb is the only way to ensure victory, you'll have no choice but to use it.*

SD_LastNightAlive_37.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_37.text: *Your resolve is steady. It is not just Mystra you save with your sacrifice. Faerûn itself depends on you.*

SD_LastNightAlive_15.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_15.text: Her gifts have their uses, but she still leaves the hard work to you.

SD_LastNightAlive_64.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_64.text: *If the Heart of the Absolute is within reach, it's not because of her intervention. It's because of your efforts. Your struggle. Your life being put on the line.*

SD_LastNightAlive_52.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_52.text: She forced her favours upon you. You owe her nothing.

SD_LastNightAlive_66.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_66.text: *Your obedience cannot be guaranteed by such piecemeal rewards as Mystra deigns to give.*

SD_LastNightAlive_2.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_2.text: Useless trifles. She still keeps the Weave's true power for herself.

SD_LastNightAlive_51.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_51.text: *Perhaps these favours are intended to appease you. To make you hunger for the even greater reward she will bestow if you continue to obey.*

SD_LastNightAlive_9.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_9.text: *She offers you only the chance, the hope of redemption. Would you really give your life on such flimsy promises?*

SD_LastNightAlive_26.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_26.text: Impossible. Elminster's utterly devoted to her.

SD_LastNightAlive_44.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_44.text: *Elminster's life has been spent in unwavering service to Mystra. He worships her devoutly, as you once did. So why would he plant such doubts in you now?*

SD_LastNightAlive_41.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_41.text: It could be sabotage, an attempt to deny you your chance at redemption...

SD_LastNightAlive_39.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_39.text: *Mystra chose you for this task, not Elminster. Could jealousy lie at the heart of his insistence that you intentionally fail in your duty?*

SD_LastNightAlive_22.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_22.text: *Though the shadow magic you consumed is nothing compared to your old mastery of the Weave, it is novel. Exciting. And in Mystra's eyes, dangerous.*

SD_LastNightAlive_48.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_48.text: She has no right to interfere. You don't answer to her.

SD_LastNightAlive_21.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_21.text: *That you still live and breathe is a miracle in itself. A sign that Mystra may be unwilling to directly intervene.*

SD_LastNightAlive_54.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_54.text: *Or is her silence merely the hope that you may yet follow the self-destructive path she desires, without the need to force your hand?*

SD_LastNightAlive_17.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_17.text: Dangerous or not, you need all the help you can get.

SD_LastNightAlive_23.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_23.text: *Though the powers you gained are not savoury in their origin, that will matter little if they keep you, and the orb, in one piece.*

SD_LastNightAlive_5.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_5.text: You've been indulging yourself. No harm in that.

SD_LastNightAlive_4.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_4.text: *Following your curiosity, wielding unknown magic... You feel more like yourself than you have in months. And who knows how long your 'self' has left?*

SD_LastNightAlive_53.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_53.text: *Each day brings you closer to finding the Heart of the Absolute. The source of Mystra's fear. And, for you, perhaps her forgiveness...*

SD_LastNightAlive_18.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_18.text: She's going to be disappointed. You've no intention of dying.

SD_LastNightAlive_20.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_20.text: You'll learn more about the Heart. Only then will you decide.

SD_LastNightAlive_56.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_56.text: *You would not simply destroy something so valuable. To do so would be foolish, irresponsible even.*

SD_LastNightAlive_38.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_38.text: *You must learn more about the Heart of the Absolute. After all, such power could come in useful, in the right hands.*

SD_LastNightAlive_63.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_63.text: You will destroy the Absolute. Not for her, but for everyone else.

SD_LastNightAlive_47.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_47.text: You will reward her faith in you. When the time comes, you will be ready.

SD_LastNightAlive_58.speaker: Gale
SD_LastNightAlive_58.text: She might be right. You've drawn powers from a grim source.

SD_LastNightAlive_55.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_55.text: *The magic you called on will have its uses, but you can't shake the feeling you lost something of yourself in the bargain.*

SD_LastNightAlive_14.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_14.text: *Still, there is time yet to set your course straight. All may be forgiven, if you serve her as Elminster instructed.*

SD_LastNightAlive_31.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_31.text: *For the first time since the orb sank its claws into your chest, you feel your pulse quicken with a familiar sensation.*
SD_LastNightAlive_31.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale lies on his bed roll, restless

SD_LastNightAlive_42.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_42.text: *In crafting the shadow lantern, you recaptured a taste of what you once had - the power to create, to compel, to imagine. It was exhilarating. And in Mystra's eyes, dangerous.*

SD_LastNightAlive_67.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_67.text: *You try to rest, but the tadpole within you has other plans. It writhes and stretches, comfortable within your skull. As comfortable as you've become wielding it.*

SD_LastNightAlive_11.speaker: Narrator
SD_LastNightAlive_11.text: *Even at the height of your powers, you'd never have dreamed of commanding such a creature, or using its will to amplify your own. It's exhilirating, and in Mystra's eyes, dangerous.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_0.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_0.text: *Elminster's visit weighs heavy on your mind. His is a face you did not expect to see again.*
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gale lies on his bedroll, restless

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_10.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_10.text: *When you last saw him, you were in your prime. No orb. No tadpole. A mage of growing renown, all power, pride and potential - beloved by the goddess of magic herself.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_20.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_20.text: *It's one thing to have fallen from such heights, but to have Elminster himself now witness your humilation is almost unbearable.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_9.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_9.text: His disappointment cuts deeper even than Mystra's. He was your hero...

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_4.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_4.text: *While most know of Elminster the legend, few know him as you have. He plucked you from obscurity. Offered you his guidance. His faith. And most recently, his pity.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_12.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_12.text: You wonder, did he even try to intervene on your behalf?

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_2.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_2.text: *Elminster has served Mystra loyally for centuries. If he has any doubts, he's keeping them close to his chest.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_6.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_6.text: *The stakes of the task ahead are clear. The Absolute threatens more than Faerûn. It threatens the goddess of magic herself.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_3.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_3.text: You think on the Netherese magic affecting your tadpole. A magic Mystra abhors...

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_14.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_14.text: *The last great threat to Mystra's role as protector of the Weave was at the hands of the Netherese wizard, Karsus.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_21.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_21.text: *His empire, Netheril, has long since crashed and burned, but traces of its magic still remain, if you know what to look for. Spells. Artefacts. Weapons...*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_1.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_1.text: *Whatever lies at the Heart of the Absolute, it's powerful enough to inspire the fear of the gods themselves. What else could it be capable of?*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_19.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_19.text: To wield enough power to threaten a god. That would be quite something...

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_24.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_24.text: *Somewhere in these shadow-cursed lands lies a power great enough that Mystra dare not speak its true name.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_5.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_5.text: *'The Heart of the Absolute'... You will find it where it beats, and learn exactly what she's afraid of.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_26.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_26.text: The Absolute must be stopped. If this is the only way, so be it.

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_22.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_22.text: *You've witnessed first-hand the Absolute's depravity. It's quite something to know you now have the power to wipe it from existence with a snap of your fingers.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_16.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_16.text: *You'd die too, of course, but your name would live on. 'Gale of Waterdeep, the Light of Faerûn.' If only you might live to see it.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_15.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_15.text: You failed her once. You will not fail her again.

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_7.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_7.text: *Destroy the Heart of the Absolute, and you may yet turn your greatest mistake into your greatest triumph.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_18.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_18.text: *Something stirs within you. Hope. There may yet be a chance of redemption for Gale of Waterdeep after all.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_17.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_17.text: He would never inflict such cruel terms on you. Mystra must have forced his hand.

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_11.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_11.text: *Mystra would no more forgive Elminster for defying her than she was willing to forgive you. His hands are tied. As, it seems, are yours.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_25.speaker: Gale
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_25.text: Doddering old fool. Trust him to leave the hard work to you.

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_13.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_13.text: *Elminster's a relic concerned only with preserving his own legend. He couldn't care less if this mission would rob you of your own legacy.*

SD_AfterElminsterVisit_8.speaker: Narrator
SD_AfterElminsterVisit_8.text: *Or, perhaps it's Mystra who fears she will be erased. The Heart of the Absolute not only threatens mortal life. It threatens her too.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_7.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_7.text: *You read the words, written in Karsus' own hand, and yet you can still scarcely believe it.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_17.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_17.text: *The Crown of Karsus... You've read of such an artefact, but always in veiled terms, couched in myth and rumour. Never as a reality.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_20.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_20.text: *Could this truly be the crown you saw on the brain, surging with corrupted Netherese magic? If it is indeed Karsus' fabled creation, what else could it be capable of?*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_26.speaker: Gale
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_26.text: A familiar feeling rises within you. Temptation...

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_13.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_13.text: *This could be the answer to your prayers. A gift unlike any your goddess has been willing to give.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_12.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_12.text: *Reforge it, and you would carry the most powerful artefact in the realms. A better fate than the one Mystra offered you.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_27.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_27.text: *She's aware of your discoveries - Elminster's visit betrays that much. What else does she know? What else hasn't she told you?*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_22.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_22.text: *Between the Heavens and the Hells, the fate of the Crown hangs in the balance, and you will be the one to decide it.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_15.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_15.text: *It's time you sought out her shrine. There, she will acknowledge the secrets she's kept from you. And this time, she will not deny you anything.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_19.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_19.text: *It's time the Mother of All Magic heard what you have to say. Time for you to find her shrine, and claim a long-witheld audience.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_6.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_6.text: *Whatever secrets Mystra keeps from you, she will surrender them. She has no choice, now the Crown of Karsus is almost within your reach.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_23.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_23.text: *The orb, the parasite, and now the Crown... Netherese magic haunts you at every turn. It's time you understood its full potential.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_18.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_18.text: *Sorcerous Sundries must be your next port of call.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_2.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_2.text: *If there is more to discover about Karsus' creations, their shelves are your best hope of finding it. And once you've learned his secrets, your prayers may finally be answered.*
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_2.context: NodeContext: Sense of anticipation here at what this knowledge could give Gale

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_0.speaker: Gale
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_0.text: Such power leads to only one outcome. Corruption...

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_3.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_3.text: *In taking control of the Crown, the Dead Three's Chosen enslaved an elder brain, infecting half the Sword Coast with tadpoles. And that was without a true understanding of Karsus' powers.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_11.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_11.text: *Destroy the crown without first destroying your contract with Raphael, and there will be hells to pay. The devil will make sure of that.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_25.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_25.text: *Destroy it, and the world would be a safer place. No doubt this is the course Mystra hoped you would follow, while keeping you ignorant of your true purpose.*

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_10.speaker: Gale
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_10.text: Nothing, unless you can find a way to defeat the elder brain...

SD_KnowCrownKarsus_9.speaker: Narrator
SD_KnowCrownKarsus_9.text: *Whatever the Crown's potential, for now it is impossible to detach from its wearer. So long as the elder brain lives, Karsus' Crown will never be yours.*
